intro: Papaver syriacum, commonly known as the Syrian poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has palmate leaves with lobed edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. The seeds of Papaver syriacum are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural spread in suitable habitats.
